snippet: Republicans around the country are offering pointed advice, sobering in its candor, for Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, after his top aides were linked to the Fort Lee scandal.
abstract: Republican leaders are urging New Jersey Gov Chris Christie to let go of his fierce loyalty to old friends and high school classmates who have risen with him in state government and to recruit a more nationally savvy political team; party cannot afford serious damage to Christie's credibility as a result of George Washington Bridge traffic jam scandal, as he is the newly installed chairman of the Republican Governors Assn and potential 2016 presidential contender.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO, JONATHAN MARTIN and NICHOLAS CONFESSORE
byline.contributor: Jeremy Peters and Ravi Somaiya contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Republicans around the country are offering pointed advice, sobering in its candor, for Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, after his top aides were linked to the Fort Lee scandal.

headline.main: G.O.P. Advice for Christie: Pick a Better Team
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Advice for Christie: Pick a Better Team
